poem:
### Ceasefire Call

Among the icebound echoes,  
where leaders trade breath  
like frost on the air,  
lips shape the word 'peace'—  
a whispered hope, brittle  
as tundra underfoot,  
though trumpets cry brass  
and snow melts fast—all the while  
a clock ticks towards silence,  
a summit of sunlit truce  
in a world turning silver and still.
